alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:58PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, eastern Pike, west central Grant, northwestern Dallas, southern Garland, southeastern Montgomery and Hot Spring Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lonsdale to near Pearcy to 5 miles south of Norman. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Arkadelphia... Malvern... Glenwood... Gurdon... Rockport... Amity... Caddo Valley... Sparkman... Perla... Okolona... Lonsdale... Gum Springs in Clark County... Meyers... Lofton... Rockwell... DeGray Lake State Park... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Halfway... Richwoods... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for western Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
